TENTACLES.Definition: power or influence that spreads into many areas

BOOM.Definition: a period of fast growth or success

ASSUMED OFFICE.Definition: officially taken control or taken on his position

DEREGULATION.Definition: reducing rules or laws in businesses or industry

WHIZZES.Definition: people who were very good at technology or finance

INNOVATIVE.Definition: new and creative, introducing new ideas or methods

POOLING.Definition: combining together for a shared purpose

BALANCE SHEET.Definition: a financial statement showing assets and debts

ASSET.Definition: something valuable that a company or person owns

FACILITATED.Definition: made it easier or helped make it happen

DARLING.Definition: someone who was very popular and admired

WANTED TO TOUCH WITH A TEN-FOOT BARGE PO.Definition: wanted to get involved with at all

GOLDEN BOY.Definition: a man who was very successful and admired

A BIT OF A MOUTHFUL.Definition: difficult to say or remember because it's long or complicated

FLEDGLING.Definition: new and still developing or growing

TRACK RECORD.Definition: history of past achievements or failures

INFLATION.Definition: the situation when prices rise, reducing the value of money

QUANTIFY.Definition: measure or express it in terms of numbers

CUSTODIANS.Definition: people or organisations responsible for taking care of it

ASSETS.Definition: things of value, such as money or property, that a company or person owns

CONCEIVABLE.Definition: possible to imagine or think of

NODDING YOUR HEAD.Definition: agreeing or showing understanding by moving your head up and down

BRINGING DOWN.Definition: causing it to fail or collapse

WENT BUST.Definition: went bankrupt or lost all money

BAILED OUT.Definition: helped by receiving money to avoid failure

ARCHITECTS.Definition: people who designed or planned it

WHOLE HOST OF.Definition: a large number or variety of

GO-TO.Definition: the best or most reliable choice

OUTSMART.Definition: defeat or trick by being clever

SPROUTED.Definition: caused to appear suddenly or quickly

CABAL.Definition: a small group of people who plan something secretly

UNDERLYING.Definition: lying or situated under or beneath

SPEAK HIS MIND.Definition: say exactly what he thinks, without holding back

WOKE.Definition: aware of social and political issues, especially around justice and equality

REVOLVING DOOR.Definition: a situation in which people move between jobs in government and industry

WRAP THINGS UP.Definition: finish or bring things to an end

CLICKBAIT.Definition: attention-grabbing but misleading online content designed to get clicks

SIMPLIFICATION.Definition: the process of making it look less complicated than it is

VEIN.Definition: a tube that carries blood to the heart (used here metaphorically, meaning "source of wealth")
